# Contributing Guidelines

Thank you for your interest in contributing! We welcome improvements of all kinds — bug fixes, new features, documentation updates, and thoughtful discussions. This guide outlines how to contribute effectively and respectfully.

---

## How to Contribute

### 1. Fork the Repository
Create your own fork and work from a feature branch:

```bash
git checkout -b feature/my-change
```

### 2. Make Your Changes
Keep changes focused and cohesive. If your contribution touches multiple areas, consider splitting it into separate pull requests.

### 3. Follow Coding Standards
- Match the existing style and conventions.
- Add or update tests when appropriate.
- Keep commits clean and descriptive.

---

## Pull Requests

Before opening a PR:

- Ensure your branch is up to date with `main`.
- Fill out the pull request template completely.
- Make sure all CI checks pass.
- Keep PRs small and focused when possible.

### PR Title Format
Use a clear, descriptive title. If your project uses a convention (e.g., Conventional Commits), follow it:

```text
type: short description
```

Examples:
- feat: add user authentication
- fix: correct null reference in parser
- docs: update installation instructions

---

## AI Disclosure

If you used AI tools (e.g., GitHub Copilot, ChatGPT, Claude) to assist with code, documentation, or design:

- Disclose this in the PR template.
- Describe what the AI helped with.
- Verify all AI‑generated content for correctness, security, and licensing.

---

## Testing

Please ensure:

- All existing tests pass.
- New features include appropriate test coverage.
- Tests are deterministic and easy to understand.

---

## Issues & Discussions

Before opening a new issue:

- Check if one already exists.
- Provide clear steps to reproduce bugs.
- For feature requests, explain the motivation and potential impact.

---

## Code of Conduct

By participating, you agree to uphold our Code of Conduct. Be respectful, constructive, and inclusive.

---

## Thank You

Your contributions help make this project better for everyone. We appreciate your time, effort, and creativity.
